Hindari Cuaca Buruk, MotoGP Minta Tanggal Phillip Island Diubah
06 Nov 2019, 11:00 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Meski pemandangan alam Sirkuit Phillip Island, Australia, sedang cantik-cantiknya pada bulan Oktober, angin kencang dan cuaca yang tak menentu membuat MotoGP semakin resah ketika harus menjalani balapan di sana. Atas alasan ini, perubahan tanggal penyelenggaraan pun tengah digodok.
MotoGP Australia, 25-27 Oktober lalu membuktikan rasa cemas pebalap dan tim. Puncaknya terjadi saat debutan Red Bull KTM Tech 3, Miguel Oliveira, mengalami kecelakaan hebat dalam kecepatan tinggi di Tikungan 1 akibat angin kencang pada sesi latihan keempat (FP4). Insipen ini pun membuat sesi dihentikan.
Para rider MotoGP menggelar rapat Komite Keselamatan secara mendadak. Sesi kualifikasi pun ditunda sampai Minggu pagi, dan Oliveira sendiri harus absen di tiga seri akibat kerusakan tendon pada kedua pergelangan tangan dan kerusakan ligamen pada bahunya sejak Silverstone jadi kian memburuk.
Cuaca berangin dan dingin ini pun membuat Dorna Sports selaku promotor MotoGP mendorong Australian Grand Prix Corporation (AGPC) untuk memindahkan tanggal penyelenggaraan ke bulan Maret atau April pada 2021 nanti. Menurut Motorsport.com, ide ini sejatinya bahkan telah dimiliki Dorna Sports sejak lama.
text:
Avoid Bad Weather, MotoGP Asks for a Changed Phillip Island Date
Nov 6 2019, 11:00 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Although the natural scenery of the Phillip Island Circuit, Australia, was pretty-beautiful in October, strong winds and erratic weather made MotoGP more anxious when having to race there. For this reason, a change in the date of implementation is being discussed.
Australian MotoGP, 25-27 last October proved the anxiety of the rider and the team. The climax occurred when the Red Bull KTM Tech 3 debutant, Miguel Oliveira, had a severe accident at high speed in Bend 1 due to high winds in the fourth training session (FP4). This incentive also made the session terminated.
MotoGP riders hold Safety Committee meetings suddenly. The qualifying session was postponed until Sunday morning, and Oliveira herself had to be absent in three series due to tendon damage to both wrists and ligament damage to her shoulders since Silverstone was getting worse.
This windy and cold weather also made Dorna Sports as the promoter of the MotoGP push the Australian Grand Prix Corporation (AGPC) to move the organizing date to March or April in 2021. According to Motorsport.com, this idea has actually even been owned by Dorna Sports for a long time.
